caption: Great experience!! Mad at myself for not going here sooner.  What a meal to remember. Thanks for the great service.

Second time I've had the pleasure of eating here. The food is unsurpassed and the staff treats everyone like royalty. The timing on when our dishes arrived was impeccable. It was quite the phenomenal experience. Thank you, everyone, who was a part of it. I will be back.
The happy hour menu it's self is a 10⭐ Amazing food, our waitress Amanda was fantastic

I dont see what all the hype is about. We went last night and was shocked by the prices. The steak was good but i have had just as good at other local steak houses for way less money. I have also had better service at other places. I paid with two $100 gift cards that i know for a fact were not used or the pin scrathed on the back. They brought one back and said there was nothing on the card and it was already scratched. I was ripped off for $100 which really ruined the night. I will never go there again.
Excellent as always
Celebrating my FIL 80th. Ricardo our server made our night very special! He was a pro! Food was excellent and we felt safe as folks were spread out and all employees wearing masks.
Delish as always.
Great food. Great happy hour deals.
First time ever going and it was phenomenal the food was perfect the service was incredible will definitely be back

incredible service, everyone is super nice. went for an anniversary and they really make the experience personal. the food is so damn delicious. Cowboy steak 10/10, lobster mac and cheese 10/10, sweet potato casserole 10/10. looking forward to next time :D i highly recommend trying this place out if you haven't before, you won't be disappointed.
Wow!  Our first visit was a great experience!  The food was wonderful, the best steak I have ever had, and the service was great.  The staff were welcoming and attentive.  We will be going back!
Best steaks excellent service
Excellent food and waiter Brandon was awesome and kind

First time for us to eat here -- because their prices are high for our eating out budget.  However, we were invited to a retirement seminar that offered a complimentary dinner here; therefore, we jumped at the chance to visit this fine establishment! Starter was Caesar Salad which had the perfect components, temperature, and textures -- wonderful!  For entrees, my wife chose the Filet and I selected the Salmon -- both delicious!  [The manager warned everyone ahead of time that the plates would be hot. They were.]  The Salmon was served over sauteed spinach and was prepared with a tasty sauce.  Accompaniments were Mashed Potatoes and Fresh Broccoli, which were served family style to our table consisting of 2 couples.  Taste was very good; but these side dishes could have been warmer. Dessert was Chocolate Cheesecake with fresh berries -- fabulous! Overall, we enjoyed our dinner very much!  [And the seminar speaker shared useful retirement planning information to boot.]

First time here. Wonderful experience, Molly was super nice and thoughtful and funny. They brought out the food in a timely fashion and presented it on the hot plates, and the ribeye steak just melts in your mouth. 10/10
Excellent food and excellent service. All the staff were super nice and friendly.
Amazing dinner
Had a meeting there but everything was great
Great service and atmosphere! The food is amazing. :)
Really good food. I ordered the coyboy ribeye and it was perfect. Order some crab cakes as well. Food was amazing.
Quiet dinner with amazing food & drinks!
Absolutely amazing! Food that never seems to disappoint!!!
OUTSTANDING food & service!  Highly recommend!  We were pleasantly surprised to find the early dinner specials.
The service was outstanding.  The food was delicious!  Worth the price.

This was our second time here in 3 years. As much as we were looking forward to a wonderful meal and atmosphere, it was very disappointing.  The food was excellent (filet and lobster) cooked to perfection. The service was horrible. The room was crowded (absolutely not much social distancing)  We were expecting such a nice evening, as this year has been so trying. Ruth's Chris Boise, was such a disappointment.

Boise Location - Made my reservation 2 weeks in advance for my wife's birthday. The day of the reservation Ruth's Chris called me to verify and that it was my wife's birthday. I said yes, it's Theresa's 60th. They said we will be able to pick a dessert and the staff will sing happy birthday. When we got there, we were seated in the bar area. Not my first choice but oh well, food should be just as good. We were told to scan one of those qr codes to get the menu or they could bring us a paper menu. We opted for the paper menu. Our server (not sure what his name was because he didn't introduce himself) brought happy hour menus. Since we weren't there for burger and fries bar food we asked for the proper menu. We got that and ordered a couple of drinks . Mine a cognac on the rocks drink and her a lemon drop. They gave me the lemon drop and her the cognac. Ok, no big deal,  we traded our drinks. We ordered crab stuffed mushrooms for dessert. Pretty bland and tasteless.  I ordered the lobster bisque and she the tomato and bruschetta salad. Lobster bisque was good but not as good as I've had other places. The salad was not good. We then ordered the main course and we both opted for the filet mignon. Mine 11 oz and hers 8 oz. I ordered a glass of wind and she ordered another Lemon Drop. Wine was delivered to her and no Lemon Drop. I informed the waiter that the wine was for me and that she didn't get her Lemon Drop. Both Medium temperature. Got our steaks and sides. Mine was a little chewy and under cooked and lacking flavor. Hers was good.  Now for dessert. She picked the chocolate peanut butter thing which was very good. They brought it out with a candle and had "Happy Birthday Tamara" written in chocolate on the plate. That would have been great if her name was "Tamara". No one sang happy birthday which was fine with my wife. We made sure this was our dessert and told them the name was wrong. He apologized and a few minutes later, someone, I assume the manager but he also never introduced himself, brought out another plate with the correct name and a candle but managed to spell her name wrong.  It's all the little things that you expect for high end dining which make the experience. The server lacked personality and I couldn't tell you anyone's name because no one bothered to tell us. The guy in charge of filling our water glasses was the best and should be the one serving tables.  We most likely won't be back. There is a local place called Chandlers where the food and service is always impeccable (ask for Bodies table. He's great). We will stay with them when we want to splurge.
Mediocre...overpriced.
Delicious and worth the price, my friend.

First time going to the restaurant for my birthday dinner. It was super fancy and all of the staff were super friendly. I even got a free birthday dessert. But the worst of all is I got food poisoning. Don’t get me wrong, the food was good but something was not cooked or prepared correctly. Pretty dissatisfied.
Excellent food! Excellent service! We love going to  Ruth's Chris for date night! Steak and Lobster Mac and Cheese are a must!

I almost never write negative reviews. However my experience tonight was not what I expected.  I have visited this restaurant probably 20+ times over the past 3 years. It was always great food and service.  Tonight,  not so much. It was my birthday and i made a reservation for a booth and got a table.  Then, my wife and I had to wait 15 mins for bread, water and a club soda. The chopped salad was good. I ordered the crab cakes and 2 lobster tails. The crab cakes were semi fried on the outside and extremely mushy and had so much butter they were not edible.  The lobster tails were way over cooked.  My wife liked her steak. I asked the waitress to remove my salad plate and she had to get someone to do it. I guess I will have to find another place to eat, because it wasn't worth $200.
Food was good and hot. Way too pricey...
Wonderful food and wonderful service!

The food was great quality, and the service was top notch. The only reason I gave 4 stars is because my 11 oz filet mignon wasn't cooked correctly, and for being a steak house that's a big thing to mess up.

My dad took me here for my birthday and I have to say I have never experienced a more professional and knowledgeable server. She was amazing. I only wish I remembered her name. The food was brought out piping hot and was delicious to boot. Definitely recommend this place to everyone!

Sara is an incredible server and the food is magnificent.  Their prime time menu is one of the best values you can get in the city and I am looking forward to my next visit.  Thank you so much, team Ruth's Chris Boise!
Reserved a table online to celebrate our birthday. I now have expensive taste in steak because of Ruth's Chris. They were able to accommodate to hold dairy from my dishes.
Had a wonderful first mignon, stuffed mushrooms, and potatoes au gratin. Everything was delicious! Good service also
Everything was perfect!
Amazing food and great service! ,
Great service tonight.
Best steaks you can get anywhere! Impeccable service. Bit pricey for me, but it's great once in awhile.
Excellent Staff, very pleasant, helpful and willing to serve. Plenty of room and social distancing recommend you try the Steak and Lobster.
The lamb was cooked to perfection and the asparagus was excellent well trained staff and very polite

Overpriced for sure... booths are very tall and I’m very short... could barely get up there, very embarrassing. Also, one of the waiters kept walking by and creepily staring at our table without saying anything and mind you he wasn’t in charge of our table. Don’t think I’ll be going again...
Great service, excellent food! Do not miss the creme Brule martini and the peanut butter pie dessert!
Good service.  Wasn't blown away by the food.  Zuppa's has a better lobster bisque.
Great food, Brandon was an excellent waiter
Always a great fillet! Of course it's a national chain, but with good people that make for a consistent and positive experience

First time coming here tonight and we loved it! Staff were very warm and welcoming and the food was absolutely delicious. Porterhouse for two was perfectly cooked. We got it Oscar style which was a great choice. The cocktails were tasty as were all the other sides and appetizer. Will definitely be back again!
The steak was incredible! The side dishes tasted pre made .  We would definitely go back for steak and salad.
OK but not one of my favorites.
Steak was perfect.  Good Social Distancing.
Awesome service,great foods and drinks!Bring lots of money
Excellent food and service!
As always, Very Good

It was a good place for my dad's 87th birthday. It's a steak house and delivers in that concept. Service was a tad spotty but they meant well. Food was good if unmemorable. Nice location and we could sit outside.
Outstanding service and awesome food.  We will return.
Want an outstanding meal?   This is the place!!  Stephanie and the wait staff were exceptional and the food was perfect!!!   Thank you all for a truly, terrific dinner.

Wasn't thrilled. The server, Brandon, was awesome would definitely be back just to see him, but maybe have him serve me food from somewhere else...a lot of hype for small portions that are lovely to look at, but bland in the flavor hole.
Out standing service and products

Honestly everything was great,  service was great, but there were tons of flies that kept landing on my food on the patio. I understand that Flys are mostly inevitable,  but there are some measures you can take to remediate it such as large fans
AMAZING steakhouse
Great food.   Excellent service.
Great food, great service, nice atmosphere.
The steak is simply amazing. I can't imagine a filet tasting better than this.
Very chic! Amazing food.  The best service!
Hands down the best restaurant I’ve ever been to! The food was fabulous! The wait staff were amazing!! Will definitely be back!!
Good stuff.

We have come here for emery wedding anniversary (only two so far but still...) and also two Christmas dinners and it’s been excellent every time.  Tonight our server Kara made us feel so welcome.  There was an issue with my salad, it had bleu cheese which wasn’t listed on the menu, and she got it fixed right away.  At the end of the meal we were torn on two desserts so instead of comping is one, they did both. We didn’t go there with an expectation of free stuff...it’s Ruth’s Chris, you’re gonna spend some money, but those little Touches and attention to detail are why it’s worth it.  Ask for Kara if you go.  She was great.
This 40oz Ribeye was great for sharing
LOVE their cooking process and how they explain it!  Food, presentation and service was OUTSTANDING!!! An experience you'll never forget!!!  Even helped celebrate a special occasion!!!

I walked in and was greeted by the hostess and requested a patio table for four people. She asked if I had a reservation to which I replied no. She said she would see what she could do. She walked away to “check the patio” (that had several open tables spaced appropriately apart, 2 of the tables being occupied). I was quite stunned when she told me they were very busy and could not seat me. She also said that I could come in tomorrow for happy hour and usually find open seating or I could make a reservation for the next night. I said thanks and that we were looking for some birthday dessert and walked outside. It was Monday night, at 7:40pm...I could count the number of occupied tables in the entire restaurant on two hands. I walked away, told our group and just out of curiosity jumped online to see if they had reservations. I was denied a seating at 7:41pm and booked my reservation online at 7:45pm. More shock!!! It didn’t make sense. We walked around until 7:55 and went back for our reservation and were seated. In passing the hostess area I asked if they were only accepting online reservations as I was just in here, denied and then booked online. The woman froze and grasped for words, “we were very busy at that time” “we hold tables for reservations” and “we would have to ask walk ins to leave to accommodate our reservations”. While seated only one other table showed up for seating. I also felt like from where I sat that they were talking and referencing our table to two other staff (could just be my paranoia)...it tainted our whole experience. It’s a bummer, I enjoy the ambience, their wine list and their cheesecake, but I won’t be dining here again. And I won’t be recommending it to others.

Definitely one of the finest establishment in all of Boise. You're not going to find another place that delivers excellent food, outstanding services and elaborate atmosphere.  My husband always makes reservations here for us when we have something to celebrate because there's no better place to celebrate than somewhere with good food and drinks. I could delve into each menu item but that would take forever. I've seriously been here like 5 times this year and I've had a great visit every time no matter the food I order. That's all you have to know!
Good food for a high price. Service was slower than we would have liked.
Got good service great appetizers, but the steaks and the 500deg plates not as good as I expected for the price. Don't see myself going back for those prices.
The cocktails and every course were magnificent, delicious and perfect! Our family was there late in the evening, and Brandon and Alex took amazing care of us :-)

Very pleasant experience! I proposed to my fiance' here and the main manager and crew helped me set up the whole event and made it super easy for me! Food was delicious and a great relaxing environment. Thank you guys!
Took my Girlfriend Friday 7/17 for her Birthday and We ordered filet mignon and lobster it was terrible! Filet was under cooked and the lobster was rubbery $230 down the  drain.

We went for the first time for our anniversary. It was absolutely amazing! Even with all the changes needed for COVID-19, the service was great and it was the best meal my husband and I have ever had. Their cocktails are crazy good and they definitely don't skimp on the alcohol!
Great food and service as always.

This is the first time I've ever been here and I'd always been to Chandlers previously... my salmon was amazing on a bed of spinach and the steak lovers said the steak was to die for! We had the most amazing fun waiter and a great night! I highly recommend this place.
The food was amazing and our waitress "Kara" was great!

Was there to celebrate my wedding and family in town this last Sunday. Food was awesome, steak was slightly overcooked and one of the team members overheard my brother and I talking about it. We insisted they not re-make it(even a slightly over-cooked steak at Ruth's Chris is amazing), but they insisted that it needed to be perfect. They remade the steaks, brought out some sides to fill us up even more. Camden, our server went above and beyond to make sure that we were taken care of. Food was delicious and service was top notch. We left way to full and very happy with our visit. We have been there before and will continue to visit when we want the best steak and best service I have found in my 35 plus years living here. Thanks.
Don't like their food
always a classy experience
Always an amazing and flavorful experience.
More spicy shrimp please!
I've always really liked them but have lost all respect for the Organization. Even though they are returning the money, they never should have received it. I will stick to more deserving places.

“Ruth’s Chris Made $468 Million in Revenue but Gobbled Up $20 Million in Small Business Relief. The steakhouse chain has more than 150 locations and $86 million in cash reserves—and it furloughed workers.“ How can you justify taking so much money for yourselves when our small businesses don’t have nearly that much to fall back on! Give it back! You guys are neither small, nor needing relief! There’s no more money for people who need it who just happen to be your customers!
over- priced. hit Barbacoa instead
I'll never eat at one of your restaurants again, taking money away from small business. To line the pockets of your CEO, your a completely sad business.

Wow,... the crab legs,... just mmm. The scallops... Whoa. The ribeye, mmmmm... the ribeye... Yeah this particular establishment had a shout out in the latest Grace and Frankie season as Nick's favorite Ruth's Chris. Lucky me!
Simply the best steaks and service in Boise!!
Absolutely the best steak and service in Boise!
Although the steak was good,  we were a little disappointed in the consistency and taste. The potatoes were just okay.  We probably will not return.
We went here for Christmas Eve. My brother and stepmom said I couldn't eat an entire steak. I was like 3 oz away but they were right.
Wonderful food great place for an intimate celebration.
Kara was an amazing server. Made the whole night amazing!!!

This restaurant is a class act! We arrived early, then decided to go on a walkabout. Once we returned, we were seated and catered to until the moment we left! Staff was supreme! Food was excellent! Even the dessert was good, but I did tell our waiter I think I like my peanut butter ice cream pie better! 🤭 To that, I will be taking two pieces down to them, maybe this weekend...it's what I do! Thanks, Ruth's Chris Steak House ❤️
great eating experience. delicious food. go and enjoy.
We LOVE ruths chris. Great service and great food. If a mistake is made its corrected promptly
Beefy
Always a nice and fun experience. Tried the blue crab tower app and it's like having sushi! So yummy and refreshing; you literally feel so healthy eating it.
Very elegant and pricey. Amazing quality of food. Excellent service
Food is out standing! Service is top tier. And atmosphere is high class
Good food, mediocre service for a classy place, but we still had fun!
Great happy hour deals...the food and drinks are very tasty!!!
Everyone was super friendly and the food was delicious. The whole place was very clean.  The food is very expensive but like I said very good.
Great food, nice oresents.
Great salmon dinner, and chocolate dessert! w/ Rhenda.
Amazing steak!

I'm giving the restaurant a 3, but the wait staff a 5 here. First, we had reservations in advance and somehow still got stuck in the back corner of the bar area where people gather for happy hour. I'm spending around $200 for dinner, I don't want to be stuck next to a group of guys pounding beers in hooded sweatshirts for date night with my wife. (and I am that guy sometimes) Next, I ordered a filet mignon medium. What I got would barely register on the rare scale. For $50 a steak, it should be cooked perfectly. It was purple and extremely slimy. I did get it fixed, and it tasted great after. Martinis were some of the best I've ever had. Our waiter more than made up for the steak mess up and went above and beyond to fix somebody else's mess up.
Wonderful experience! Thank you so much for a great evening with my family
Lovely dinner here with friends celebrating the holidays.  The food and service were excellent.
Really great food. I know (oh do I know) this place is not cheap. But it was super delicious.
Great happy hour with $9 drinks and food
Brandon took care of us this evening and it was a fabulous experience. For me the service is as important as the meal and tonight both were excellent!
Very expensive but you are getting what you paid for
Amazing place to go for steak! If you want to eat the best steak in Idaho, come here.
lobster bisque was awful. Room temperature and bitter.
The dinner was excellent. We had a Harvest salad,  crimini mushrooms and a rib eye steak. The mushrooms and steak together was awesome.
seriously the best food i’ve ever had.
Always a good dining experience.
Great food and wonderful service great place for a date or bring your family
You are well "pampered" at this nice restaurant.  Took the wife there for her New Year Eve's birthday. We had a great meal and good time!!
Another of numerous exceptional meals we have enjoyed at Ruth's Chris Boise! Great service, great food, great atmosphere! Thank You!

Best steak in Boise Idaho. I had the 40 oz Porterhouse medium rare. WOW it melts in your mouth. My wife had the King Crab- they de shell it right at your table. We also had the portabello mushrooms and the roasted brussel sprouts. For dessert we had the house made cheesecake. All was top notch including the service.  This was our 36 year anniversary dinner. Well done Ruth's Crist.  This is a must do if you come near Boise.
Always a good meal and fantastic service... my favorite thing to order is the lobster mac n cheese... you won't be disappointed!
Amazing as always!
Great. Great food. Great atomsphere. Great location. Great service.
The lobster soup was lipsmacking yummy!!!

No doubt this is not an every weekend dinner date. It was a special evening. The filet/shrimp were excellently prepared. The service is impeccable.  You pay dearly but it is worth it and makes for a great start to an excellent evening. As an ADDED treat... have the Crem Brule afterward... close your eyes and savor ...
Side dish where cold

Great service, delicious sea bass, delicious salads. Not a place for a quick dinner, they give you a lot of time in between courses. My only complaint is that our waiter might have been a little too attentive and kept interrupting.
Superb service. Fabulous cuisine...lobster bisque to die for!
Was a nice time.
Great service, beautiful environment. Great for any date or special occasion.
Had a great experience!! Food was great, steak was cooked perfect and the bartender was extremely pleasant!
$32 for greasy scoops of 'crab cakes'? No thanks. Other dishes seemed ok but overpriced for what you get. Very attentive staff though, 5 stars for them.

The steak itself (if you take away the butter) was wonderful. I had a ribeye. Tender, flavorful. The veggies were good but everything was dripping in butter - so much that it was nauseating by meal's end. The service was dreadful. My husband had to chase down my glass of wine which finally came well past starting my steak.  5 stars for the tender steak but 1 star for service and butter.....seriously, order everything without butter.
Was wonderful.  Highly recommend to others. Thank you for a wonderful experience and celebration.
Amazing 👌🙌😍!
Always great!
Food and service is outstanding. One of our favorite places to eat.
Best Ruth's Chris I have ever eaten at! Service was impeccable, ask for Matt.
Food is simple yet delicious. Great service.
Ruth’s never disappoints!!!   From the staff and service to their menu and great drinks!   Try the martini’s!  AMAZING!   Thank you Ruth’s for another amazing dining experience!
Awesome steak house, fairly expensive but well worth it.
Always a great bet for XLNT 5 star eatin'.  Never a disappointment (well maybe the bill 🙂)
Great food. Very nice place to eat. Menu is a la cart.

Ruth Chris is an amazing resteraunt from the wait staff to the food. We went for the Boise food week special which was a 3 course dinner for $30. It was definitely worth it.  If you are ever looking for elegance, romance, or a nice time out with friends I would highly recommend Ruth Chris.
Fabulous!
Service was exceptional.  Great atmosphere, and the food is always delicious.
Perfect streaks. I really like the sides served to share.
Great service and great food
Spectacular Service... Steaks are Delish!
The service was Amazing.  The food was ok
Excellent food and service was tops and atmosphere was very elegant.
Great food, staff and manager need training.

It was our 40th wedding anniversary. Renee set it up for me to surprise my wife. Boise House of Flowers sent over a dozen roses for me. Matt was our server/host. He was awesome. My wife is very particular about how she wants her salad and steak prepared. Matt and the staff went out of their way to treat us special, which is how it should be for a milestone anniversary, in my opinion. The steaks were perfect. The meal was perfect. The presentation was perfect. The evening was perfect.

A very nice atmosphere, quiet and relaxing, for my first time here. Food was not only delicious, but good sized portions. My steak was a perfect medium rare. The staff were all friendly and prompt, especially our waiter. They made sure my parents enjoyed their anniversary.
Classy deeeeelicious happy hour fare!!
Wonderful dinner, great service
Fantastic from the moment you walk in the doors. The staff made my husbands and my 11th anniversary very special and the food was just unbelievable. We will be back soon!
Great place, great food, great service. We love going here. They always take care of us. We love the atmosphere. Feels like we’re going to see friends.
Best steak in town and a great place to go for a date night or happy hour. Great food, great drinks, great service.
Good service and professional steak. Rib eye is really taste and juicy.

Overall not worth going back. Everything was good untill you look at the price and the food. If  you look at the price alone, you would think Gordon Ramsay is cooking for you, or someone similar. If you look at the food alone, you would think it's cheaper. This place is waaay too overpriced. Just looking at the food, its good, don't get me wrong, but what I experienced is not worth the money I spent. For 2 people, it was around $250, but the food here ain't worth around $250. The staff and the decor was nice at least. One of the reason we tried this fancy schmancy restaurant was because we bought a $100 dollar gift card at Costco and we never tried this restaurant. Didn't expect to spend more than double this amount, let alone get food that isn't even worth that much.  And it wasn't like we weren't dressed properly  or anything. We both wore something nice.  2 stars for good staff and good food without considering money. 3 stars deduction for overcharging for the food and potentially underperforming kitchen, esp. for a fancy restaurant.
Great food! Great service! Great patio!
Always delicious
Best Steak I ever had

First time at Ruth's Chris in Boise, but I've been to a number of other locations. Just as good, if not better than any other location. Food was fantastic. Really amazing service. Ricardo was our server and he went above and beyond all night.  Recommend the Creme Brulee dessert. Best I've had in 20 years.
Incredibly attentive friendly staff. The food was amazing. Juicy tender steak. Moist delicious chicken. Must try sweet potatoes. And the best creme brulee we've find in 20 years!
Ruth's food is always great. Except one time in Pasadena. But this isn't Pasadena, food was great. My server was hot, Kiona. Great voice. Great smile. Great laugh.
The food was so delicious and the our waitress Molly was great, she was vary helpful and of course friendly. I'll definitely be back again!
Predictably good food.
Really great staff
Love this place for special occasions and the happy hour is excellent!
Absolutely amazing

Oh my heavens!!!!!! If you haven't been there you must go. The best steak house in town and the fish. Wonderful!!!!! Not only was the food and dessert awesome, but the waiters and servers are exceptional at their job. Will be returning again. Thanks for helping in making our anniversary memorable.
Dustin is awesome!
Love this place. Never dissapoints, great food, nice staff and fun!
Excellent food but Ruby River (no longer in Idaho - try SLC, Ogden or Provo) is just as good for 1/2 the gdmf'n price.

Very disappointed. My husband ask for a steak to go and They forgot about the order. It also took so long for the order to come and the steak came well done when it was order medium well. Cannot recommend.

Nobody does a dining experience better than Ruth Chris. Every summer I make this my last stop for my vacation. Expect a dinner experience to run about $70 per person on average. The service is top notch and if you make your reservations online you can tell them if you are coming for a special occasion. They put flowers on the tables for anniversaries, decorate desserts with messages and your waiter will know your names and why you are out on a date. There is a bar area and a section for large groups. I'll be back next year!
Consistently delicious food & the staff is top notch. This is our 3rd time taking clients there & the food is always exceptional! We highly recommend for a special night out with a REALLY good meal!
Best steak I've ever had.
If you don't think it's worth a time and money to go there you don't know what you're missing.

Dinner and service were amazing.  Ambiance was extremely nice.  It was my moms, my husbands and myselfs birthday all in one week and they made it a very special evening.  Tha lobster mac and cheese was full of lobster and one of the best I have ever had. Entrees were cooked to perfection. From salad to desert everything was perfect.  We Wii definitely be back.
Absolutely amazing service, stake, the sweet potatoes are soooo good. There isn't enough good to say about this restaurant!!!!
Great down town location & lovely atmosphere. The staff were all very professional & friendly. The food was very good though quite expensive.

For our second wedding anniversary, the staff greeted us and congratulated us numerous times by name and with well-wishes.  Our table was ready and adorned with rose petals and anniversary card. The service from every member of the staff was impeccable.  Molly (our server) was professional, fun, and engaging.  The food was great!  This meal is one of our top ten meals of all times.  All in all, a great evening.  We will be returning more often.  Thank you, Ruth's Chris Steak House!!

The service was fantastic, every employee that we came in contact with seemed happy to be there and was very friendly.  The food was very good, and the drinks that they helped us choose were all on point.
What can I say, always spectacular!

This review is from the perspective of someone who has never eaten at a place in this price bracket.  Back in December I got a gift card to here. I decided to save it until recently for my anniversary with my Girlfriend and im honestly glad I did, but the prices still we'rent the usual "bougie" for it being an upper class establishment, giftcard aside we both ate for about $60 a person. That number being a lot of people's bi-weekly grocery budget it seems high. But oh my God it was worth it. The steak; Served swimming in butter and chives on a 500F plate. The softest, most tasteful steak I have ever had. Cooked Medium, the texture was life changing. The flavor about made me shed a tear. a 12oz sirloin to split with the two of us was the perfect amount including the complimentary bread and the side of mashed potatoes we got (also being the perfect share size). The drinks; we didnt have much, just water and some strawberry lemonade. The lemonade was very well priced at $4 a glass without refills. The price being very standard didnt change how great it was. It tasted fresh and was mixed well enough that i got a good taste of both lemon and strawberry.  The service; I tend to consider service above anything else while eating out, it makes or breaks the experience for me. Absolutely incredible. The staff we're upbeat, very informative about the menu options and availability. our waitress Molly, absolutely incredible. She was so kind and prompt to our needs but gave us an excellent amount of space to enjoy the evening. I hope her supervisors see this because she did an amazing job. The rest of the staff were very attentive to us too, refilling our water while just passing by. I cant imagine the stress of keeping up a standard at a place like this but they were so good to us.  $60 a head is something i wont be doing very often, but the price is worth the experience of the incredible food, service and the upbeat yet relaxed environment. Fantastic job everyone!
Fabulous service and ambiance good  meat. A real wine list
Molly was amazing!!

Not worth the money, steak was over cooked, salty tuna/king crab , over seasoned food.... waiting staffs are great.....but, kitchen was a melt down..........this is  a chain food joint like TGIF.........
Love it every time we were there!

I dont know what took me so long to visit Ruth Chris and Im sure glad I finally did! I have heard how expensive it is and it is, but well worth it. I had the chef special rib eye that came with mashed potatoes or creamed spinach, a salad, and a dessert. It was priced at $59.00 and is a special early menu available until 6:30pm. The Caesar salad I had was so delightful. It was dressed perfectly with fresh shaved Parmesan. I skipped the anchovies. My rib eye seemed to be about 6 ounces, cooked and flavored perfectly, and the spinach was scrumptious. The rest of the table ordered ala carte with family size sides. That was a bit more expensive yet larger portions than my dinner. Filet that melted in our mouths, sea bass that was buttery and light, eye rolling to die for mushrooms, rich creamy Idaho mashed potatoes, and the yams were something special too, yet for the sweet tooth. They were topped with brown sugar and pecans. Very tasty and the table loved them but too sweet for me. My dessert was a flour-less chocolate cake and we opted for the cheesecake too. Dessert was fine and on the less sweet side so that was a pleasant ending. Extensive wine list and menu. Very satisfied with Ruth Chris!
Very elegant!
Great food. Service was a little less than I am accustomed to, but always great to eat there.
Great place for a nice dinner

I ate at Ruth's Chris Steakhouse on my last night in Boise. I got there at the tail end of happy hour and the place was packed. I found a seat at the bar and ordered the ribeye steak with baked potato and fire roasted corn. The ribeye was cooked perfect and extremely tender and juicy. It almost melted in my mouth. The corn and baked potato we're hot and fresh. The bartender was fast, friendly and kept my tea and water glass full. Excellent food and service. I definitely will go again.

Went for my anniversary and was very well taken care of! The food was absolutely divine. For the most part the atmosphere was fantastic, too many people unwilling to put in the effort to dress nice before going.
Great food and service!!
Quite spendy. Great atmosphere. Good Food.
Amazing food, staff and ambiance!! I will be back for sure
Great Food
Over the Top

Ended up here after our reservation next door was given away.  While it's fairly expensive ( all sides are purchased separately) the food and service were excellent.  We were celebrating my grandson's graduation from college.  They accommodated us spur of the moment and went out of their way to make it special, complete with private dining room.
Best steak ever!

I was finally able to make it to this Ruth's Chris. The restaurant is very clean and orderly. The bathroom appears to be shared with the business park through doors in the back.  The service was good. My water glass was only dry for short periods of time.  They were quick to deliver the food and setup for dessert.  The meal I had was a Caesar salad, with a filet, steamed broccoli, and potatoes au gratin, with a chocolate torte for dessert.  The Caesar salad was perfect, the potatoes were undercooked, and the filet was not medium as they stated it should have been.  It was more medium well/well. I feel like I could've done much better. The broccoli was good, but decided against the hollandaise sauce after only a few bites.  The chocolate torte was super delicious.  So the meal started well and ended well.  For the price. I think they got too much wrong though to give more than 3 Stars.  I hope to go back some day and try a fish option.  That will decide if I ever go back.
We just had drinks and sliders. Ruth Chris never disappoints.  Great service and atmosphere.
Good steaks

We were there Christmas Eve 2017 with snow outside and holiday lights brightening up the city. The staff were amazing; friendly, attentive and professional. The atmosphere was elegant and fancy, and the steak, wow, it was so delicious and practically melted in my mouth. The food was so good it made the back of my eyeballs sweat! Even something as simple as a baked potato was awesome in flavor and presentation. Yes, the prices are very high, and it appeared the menu items were à la carte, Our budget doesn't allow us to dine there frequently, but we will certainly be back soon.
Ruth Chris never disappoints!
Almost always hits the spot!! Can’t go wrong with a Tomahawk for two. Blue cheese Belvedere Martini please!
Great food
Happy hour menu is the best!

First time at this place. I dont think I have had a better steak. Very friendly staff. They took care of our group perfectly. Barbacoa is good, this place is great. And they have some really good seafood selections as well.
Not a fan of chain restaurants but Ruth's Chris does it right and deserves a 5 star review. The happy hour was fantastic.
username: Sunshine Window Cleaning Inc. Greg Reid

caption: Amazing food and wonderful service
Absolutely fantastic! Our Server was perfect. And the steaks are well worth the price. Expect to have a crazy bill but an equal experiance with it.
Wonderful service but the food was not that great
Awesome meal.  A bit pricey,  didn't realize that the side dishes were an extra $10 ea...
Great meat, but wasn't cooked to order. Nice ambiance and great service. However, sides and dessert (pecan pie) was so so, especially considering the price.
Wonderful service, great food!
Steak was delicious
The best steakhouse in Boise!

This place is all fluff and no good :-( super expensive for what you actually get to eat. An overcooked rubbery lobster tail that they almost dropped on the ground. A waiter that was more interested in flirting with me right across from my husband then getting his steak right. Horrible waste of time and money :-(

We order a ribeye (cooked medium) and a couple side dishes last night for a  celebratory dinner we wanted to have at our new home. So we drove to  pick it  up.  After getting home   and sat down to eat  we  cut into the must Anticipated ribeye  and  saw that IT WAS RAW!!!!  Not medium rare or rare but raw! It was so GROSS and when we called to let them know how  extremely under cooked our Steak was they offer to refund our money. well of course  but  nothing about getting us a new one just comped  the meal like they were doing us a favor. What horrible customer service and it ruined our special evening😔  then to top it off I was sick all night probably from eating E. coli! Or the side dishes.

We  are regulars to the Boise location, but last night we decided to order to take home. Well that was a mistake. The steak was ordered our usual "medium" and it was "raw" when we got home with it. Too far to drive back and have them cook it more. I called and told the manager he comped our steak, should have been the entire meal and then of the feed we could eat my wife got very sick like food poisoning and had a very rough night. We won't be returning to Ruth Chris Boise.

Every part of my experience was great, from making reservations to the complimentary desert (for our anniversary). The wait Staff were classy & friendly. The food couldn't have been better. If you are planning a celebration, romantic dinner or just want an amazing steak dinner, it can get spendy quick but it is worth it.
Dessert was delicious
Awesome food and service!!!
Great service and good food but if you're interested in a great steak dinner in Boise then I really recommend Chandler's nearby
Best steaks in town
Great food excellent portions and excellent service
What a divine ❤️ incredibly fancy AND all around cozy place this I by far one of the better 5 🌟 restaurants on boise
By far the best steak house in Boise!
Good steaks

I was visiting from out of town and didn’t do my research very well. This place is very expensive. I brought myself, spouse and three young adult kids with us. We would not care about the price so much if the food had been great, but it was simply not amazing.  The best part of our meal was the shoestring fries that we had to wait over an hour for, and we ordered them as an appitizer. I won’t beat feet back there and honestly, for the $200 plus tab the service and food should have been better than the nearby sizzler.

I was visiting from out of town and didn’t do my research very well. This place is very expensive. I brought myself, spouse and three young adult kids with us. We would not care about the price so much if the food had been great, but it was simply not amazing.  The best part of our meal was the shoestring fries that we had to wait over an hour for, and we ordered them as an appitizer. I won’t beat feet back there and honestly, for the $200 plus tab the service and food should have been better than the nearby sizzler.

Worst steak ever! Ate there last night; we shared the chopped salad (delicious), king crab legs (served drowning in butter so you can barely taste the crab & the porterhouse for two. The steak was incredibly fatty, even the filet portion, and the steak tasted like old cheap meat that was past it's used by date. When we complained, the manager seemed surprised and said the steak was good (really, he just knew because he had not tasted it) & offered to bring us a new steak. By then we didn't want a steak anymore so they packaged up the bad steak for my dogs (unsure if I should give the bad steak) & charged me ~$90 for a inedible steak. Worst Ruth's Chris experience ever. Disgusting & disappointing.

If you have lots of money, and can't cook a decent steak then this is your place.  I found the filet mignon was excellent, perfectly cooked.  Did not like ala carte sides.  It was spendy to say the least.  I've got comparable food for half the price in other places near there.  But the food was good at Ruth's Chris

The absolute best steak I have ever had in my life. I ordered it medium rare, and know I understand the phrase "like butter". Usually I need use salt on my food, including steak. I don't think there was any in the table. But I didn't need it. The flavor was exquisite, and the steak absolutely melted in my mouth. I wish I could afford the $300 tab more than once a year!
They put dairy in everything
Great steaks! Very luxurious.
Great service...good steak...but i liked the scallops better 😁😁😁.
Steak was delicious and service impeccable
Great customer service. Amazing food.
Best dinner ever! We celebrated our first wedding anniversary here and it was amazing.  The drinks, the steaks, the service was all top notch.  It was a little spendy but worth it.
Great dinner, great service...wonderfil experience!
Best!
Love the atmosphere and the food!  One of my favs!
Best steak ever! The wait staff was exceptional! We will return again and again just to feel the way they made us feelspecial
Best Happy Hour!
Ask for Richardo...your night will be perfect...

The entree prices here are OD expensive, but the Happy Hour (4:30 - 6:30) is FANTASTIC, which is what this review will be based on. The restaurant opens at 4:30, however if you get there a little early, the door is open for you to wait in the main lobby. I read another review where someone mentioned to get here early since there might be a line and you’d have a chance of missing out on the Happy Hour (since it’s ONLY held in the Bar area, which is actually very spacious and consists of the long bar counter AND the tables / booths surrounding it), but to my surprise there were only 5 other people ahead of us. What my party did was pre game a little at Lucky Fins prior to coming here, mainly due to how cold it was outside. In warmer weather you can just walk around downtown until the place opens (Freak Alley is a MUST for out of towners).  The food here was impressive, especially to someone who doesn’t eat at these fancy restaurants (yes, I DEFF consider this place fancy / high end). I tried a couple of the HH menu items (Prime Bleu Cheese Bacon Burger, Grilled Tenderloin Salad, Ruth’s Tenderloin Sliders), and the stand outs to me were the Prime Bleu Burger and the Tenderloin Salad. The burger was soft and filling, and the salad had lightly grilled steak (medium rare maybe, idk they didn’t ask how we wanted the meat done). But damn, I never had steak like that before, even if it was a small(ish) portion (which the amazing taste made up for). If you come here for the HH, my recommendation would be to get the salad first, and THEN get that Bleu Burger. At $9 each, that’s a helluva 1-2 combo, trust me. The sliders were alright, but I’d skip them, mainly due to the bang for buck value (#brokeboyz). If I HAD to pick a negative, I’d say I would’ve liked the fries crispier, but they were still tasty AF.  I also tried a handful of the drinks (Pomegranate Martini, Classic Cosmo, Ruth’s Manhattan, Gin Basil Smash), and the stand out to me was the Ruth’s Manhattan, which had a strong taste that I loved (my kind of “heater” to use when trying to warm up on a cold day). The Gin Basil came in second, it’s refreshing and would go great on a summer hot day. The ladies will LOVE the first two (Martini & Cosmo), both are “girly” drinks, but still tasty (JUDGE ME FAM, I LIKED THEM TOO).  Finally, the atmosphere / vibe in here is businessy (meaning most people here are dressed up and not wearing a tshirt and shorts), so I’d recommend putting a little effort into looking nice when coming here, just so you don’t stand out, and make it look like you eat at these baller places on the regular. Dining areas (Bar area and the main dining areas) were clean and tidy, bathrooms were nice. Service (the fine ladies greeting us, our waiter, the servers), were all professional. You can really tell the difference in overall service & presentations when comparing this place to other restaurants / steak houses (Texas Roadhouse, Outback, etc). I was surprised to find out this was a chain restaurant, it felt so unique to me.  In conclusion, this is a straight up 5 for me. I feel like their Happy Hour menu was very fair when taking into consideration the food presentation, quality of food / taste, and the premium atmosphere. If this is your first time coming, I’d highly recommend coming during HH, just to get a feel for the food / vibe and not break the bank. After coming here for my first time and having such a positive experience, it really makes me curious to try their full price entrees, which is exactly what the goal of a Happy Hour for a business is. If a $9 burger was one of (if not the best) burgers I’ve ever had, you better believe their real menu items have GOT to be GAF. I’m picky when giving out 5 stars, but this is one of a few places that I believe is a 5 all day.  *BROKE BOYZ* Secret: Costco sells $100 gift card to this place for $80. Copping that & coming to Happy Hour almost feels like a cheat code.
Always awesome
Food was great but expensive. Seems like almost everything is al la carte which just bumps the price higher if you want sides.  Waiter suggested a side that we ordered and didnt turn out very good.

[Feb 10, 6 pm] I ordered the Cowboy Rib Eye and it tasted like hot salty butter with a hint of steak flavor. I talked to my guest (it was my dad's birthday) and we both agreed that Ruth's must have accidentally cooked the salt block instead of the cow. Our steaks were horribly over-seasoned and over-buttered.
You get what you pay for. Top notch excellent service and amazing food. Best steaks in town and a staff that makes everyone feel special. Always perfect.
Great food and service is top notch
Great food, a little pricey and not a very romantic atmosphere.
Good food, good drinks, great service.
Amazing ribeyes!

Showed up 30 minutes early for reservation and they still seated us with an available table. From our host, server and the Manager we had the best service I have had in a long time. My wife and I had the filet mignon and it was absolutely amazing. The sides, desert and atmosphere exceeded our expectations. Nice Job Boise Ruth's Chris team.
Excellent food excellent service! It was everything we expected and more. The cream and berries dessert is to die for.
Really good steaks but you are paying a premium. Would recommend making a reservation.
JD and Nico were great! Food is out of this world! Dessert is a must!

Wow. Great service and even better steak. I got the rib eye. It was cooked perfectly and was very tender. I enjoyed every bite. The waiters were fantastic and anticipated our every need. Kudos to the chef for accommodating my wife's special request of adding half a filet of salmon to her salad. We'll definitely be back!
Great food and great service.

Our table was ready, rose petals, a greeting and  several personal welcomes from the staff.  Service was impeccable,  waitstaff... perfect and professional.  Food.... fantastic, everything we hoped for.  A lovely evening.....except... several diners, 4, dressed in t shirts or even dining with their coats on, it was 50 degrees outside, and, worst dress code violation,  wearing their ball caps....through out the entire dinner service.  Such a beautiful restaurant,  such professional service and excellent food.  Patrons should be more respectful and the dress code, which we checked online before we made a reservation for a very special occasion,  should be enforced.  Loved , loved this restaurant. We will be here again, just hope the dress code is enforced.  Too nice of a restaurant to have folks looking so slovenly. The staff and service, and food deserve better.
Very nice and very expensive, but I wasn't buying so... The food and service is second to none.
Stellar! Happy Hour 4:30-6:30 was so we'll priced!
Wonderful food.  Great service, they go out of there way to make you feel special. The sweet potato side is amazing, very sweet but great!
Everything about the meal was perfect. Enough food that you made want to your side dishes. Wait staff stopped by several times ensure we had everything we needed.

We had an enjoyable Company dinner at Ruth's Chris.  My wife and I had their Prime Time dinner special which is a great way to get a complete dinner including dessert for one price.  We chose the Petite Filet as our protein, which is an …

The food is hands down amazing. I would believe it to be indisputable.  Maybe not by a Vegan, but everyone else.  It is definitely a place for the "upper class" person.  I have no problem to them catering to that crowd, just keep in mind when you walk in that there is little chance of walking out of there spending less $125.  I'm not a wine drinker, so I don't know the potential nightmare that they face.  If you are a blue collar guy like me and wanting to splurge with a significant other, you will feel real cool for a couple hours and a little sick when you leave when realize how much money you spent on a steak.  Worth the experience.
Was a great atmosphere, but the food wasn’t as great as I thought it was going to be for the high price.
Great food, better service, love the atmosphere, can't beat their happy hour. Try the gin basil smash!
Well, it's probably the best steak there is. Definitely going again.
Very tasty, it’s freaking amazing
We love going to Ruth's Chris! Incredible service. Amazing food. Top shelf drinks! The list goes on. Thanks for a great dining experience.
Very good steak, but even more expensive..

We save this place for those special occasions and they never disappoint.  Yes is it a little more $$$$ than most but the food is top quality and the service is extraordinary!  They make you feel like a queen and king.  You can't match their steaks for tenderness and taste and the sides we love are the cheese potatoes and the mushrooms.  Don't forget the banana pie tart.  It is to die for.  The bar is modern with steel like the city but the dinning room is warm and inviting.  Plan ahead and ask for a booth.  They are what make it special.  Enjoy!
In my opinion, no better steak out there.  Great location as well for after dinner activities.
Always a delightful experience! Delicious food, and wonderful staff!
Best rib eye I have eaten

Went for our 25th Anniversary, had a great time. Our server Amanda was inviting and engaging. Food was excellent. Only issue was that I was charged $4 per glass of soda 4 times when I only had 3, and I didn't think about it until after we were long gone.  Mistakes happen, and it didn't ruin the night or the experience, but when charging per glass on an item that many places refill at no charge, at least make sure you have the quantity right.
Great  place for  special occasions. Wonderful  food and service.

We visited on Saturday night and took a couple of our friends for their 1st visit. The food was amazing, the crab cakes, lobster bisque and fillets couldn't have been any better.  The server was on point. He checked with us often but wasn't overtop. For people who dont  enjoy fine/ala carte dinning may want to look elsewhere  for less expensive options.
Excellent service and food!
Great Happy Hour in the bar.  Nice seating & pleasant surroundings

I ordered a t-bone steak, harvest salad, and lobster mac & cheese. The steak was thick and very tender, but the flavor simply registers as broiled steak. I'd take a cheap sirloin from a charcoal grill over a top tier oven broiled cut any day. The salad seemed to have been designed chiefly for aesthetics, with dry lettuce and arugula overwhelming the flavor of the dressing, pecans, and blue cheese crumbles. The lobster mac & cheese was the best I've had, thanks to the chili peppers, I suppose, and it complimented the steak very well.  The atmosphere of the restaurant was perfect for a night out with friends. Our booth was comfortable and felt reasonably secluded. There is an inescapable franchise feel to the place and the menu, however. I know that's important sometimes, especially when traveling, but this is my home town. For this kind of money there are plenty of other places with good atmosphere and better food.
Not impressed
Food was good.  Steaks need more seasoning.  Our waiter was 10 star. Thanks Cameron.
It's the only cheesecake that taste like mama used to bake it!
Excellent service and food. Always the best steak!
Great food and service. We do happy hour burgers most of the time. Best burger in town. A bit pricey, but well worth it when you are downtown.
Nah. Overpriced and over salted steaks.
Probably the best steak I've had. I'd highly recommend the mashed potato too. Not cheap but lovely venue for a special occasion

Disappointing to say the least.   Although I must complement of chef because the food was fantastic but the overall experience lacked in every way.    We were celebrating my daughter‘s birthday and they did absolutely nothing to make it special for her other than telling her happy birthday when we walked in the door.   I had seen pictures of  birthday desserts for other customers  were they had written happy birthday on the plate and the presentation was actually quite nice so I thought they would make her night special however we ordered dessert for her and it came just like everyone else’s!   Not even a happy birthday sentiment when they delivered it to her.  Most of the staff was not what you would expect for a high-end restaurant.   Our waiter in particular was over-the-top at times and underwhelming at other times.    He joked around a lot but didn’t really have any answers to questions we presented him with .  The secondary waiter actually left dirty silverware on the table even though I put it on my plate for him to take away,  seriously...if we’re going to spend $375 on dinner for three people can we  at least get some clean silverware?  The presentation of the food was the most disappointing part of the entire evening,  you would expect a $66 fillet to be presented with some class however they sent it out on a white appetizer platter with absolutely no presentation whatsoever.   Even a sprig of rosemary or thyme would have made it look a little bit more appealing!  Needless to say we will not be returning, there are too many other restaurants in Boise where the service is fabulous and the presentation is incredible unlike the lackluster experience we had last night.
The prices are so insane. Steaks were good but not worth the money and You have to buy steaks and sides separately.

Disappointing at best. Part of it was being in a group. They tell you all steaks for a group will be medium. I like medium rare. Mine was actually medium well. Just killed a good filet. Potatoes were undercooked. For the price, I wouldn't recommend them.
Beast steak ever
Always amazing food and service! Best steakhouse in the valley.
Awesome food great atmosphere
Very expensive the crab was small the steaks were too small to

We went on a Tuesday night around 7:30pm. We had the dine out restaurant week special. It was very good. Everything cooked perfectly. It even included dessert. Service was excellent. Everytime my water was a tiny bit down it was refilled. We were checked on several times. We will be back to try happy hour.

Wonderful atmosphere. Friendly and attentive staff. Good food. Best steak and potatoes in boise. The steak was cooked perfectly. Everything was well seasoned and separate Spouse wasn't a fan of the lobster bisque. But it is a steakhouse . :) Would definitely go again!
As good as it looks
Best steak I have ever had. Fantastic server made dinner a great experience.
One of the most consistently excellent meals that you can get. The price is high, and it is deserved. I have never been disappointed.

Incredible steak. Melted like butter in my mouth. They bend over backwards to make your experience a good one. It is a little pricey, plus, you shouldn’t dress like you would if you were to go to a chain restaurant like Applebee’s. Many were wearing shirt and tie.

We live in California,  and every year we go to a new state for our anniversary. The reviews on this place were good, so we made reservations. It is in the middle of town, so you will have to pay for parking.  I was a bit surprised on the prices. I figured it must be amazing. Unfortunately my expectations were too high. The portions were large. But quantity over quality is not always ideal.  They had a table ready for us with a card that said happy anniversary, and some rose petals on the table. Anyone that came to our table said happy anniversary. That was super nice.  everything is ala carte, which also surprised me. I figured with the prices, it would come with two sides. lol. They bring bread for the table. Which wasn't all that great. Just basic French bread.  I got the New York strip steak. 16 oz. I asked for it well done. It still had a little pink to it, but I just ate it instead of sending it back. The flavor was pretty good.  The sides are big enough for two. So we shared. We got the sweet potato casserole. It did not have a lot of flavor, I was a bit disappointed in it. Quite dry. Needs lots more butter. we got the scalloped potatoes, which were so Bland. There's a thin layer cheese on top and that's it. I didn't even want to eat that. We also got the brussel sprouts which were actually pretty good. I would have to say those were my favorite.  My husband got the ribeye, which was really good. He added the lobster for $25. Quite a waste of money. He did not enjoy it at all. It was just basic and didn't have a great flavor.  For our meals and three cocktails, it was just over $200. Not a huge deal if the food is amazing. But their price tags and the quality of food don't match.  Our server was nice. But she would disappear for quite long periods. She had been gone so long we forgot who our server was, and ordered something from someone that wasn't our server, who seems a bit irritated. after we finished eating, We sat there for about 20 minutes until she brought the bill.  There was another guy, who was a server for the tables around us. We wish we had gotten him. He was very attentive to his tables and very bubbly and outgoing. our server was friendly but basic and we only seen her 3 times. We found ourselves constantly looking around for her, and just asking random staff for things we needed.  They let us pick out a free dessert for our anniversary. We picked the key lime pie. It was pretty good. Wasn't a terrible experience, but we were going back and forth between two places. I wish we had picked the other.
Ribey steak was awesome. At least everyone greeted us with happy anniversary.
Great food and great atmosphere. Highly recommended.
I was expecting better overall
Great for and wonderful service.

The price is as high as the quality. The food was amazing, the service was exemplary. We should have ordered half and shared. The servings were very large. My filet minion was so tender it melted in my mouth.
Always great food and service!
That filet! Melts. In. Your. Mouth!

Great service, great steak and a wonderful night with friends. Had a great experience would have earned 5 stars but the potatoes au gratin were undercooked. When asked if we wanted them boxed because they were not being eaten we stated they were undercooked. The service staff did nothing to right that, hopefully the feedback makes it to the kitchen.
Love this restaurant. Food is fantastic. The service is wonderful. My wife and I celebrate our anniversary here and they always make it special for us. Thank you Ruth' s Chris.

Steak were really good.  However they mixed up our steaks, so we didnt get the "cook" we asked for on them.  It was so dark in there we couldn't really tell until I tried a bite of the other one.  Wish I had that one from the beginning.   Lobster mac and cheese was delicious.    Asparagus was awful.  Barely cooked, tough, bitter, fibery...   Bearnaise sauce iffy too :-(    8 spears of raw asparagus for $11.00.  We ate very little of it.  A bit of a gyp.   The dessert was quite nice, and with an anniversary message on the plate.   Worth the cost?  Mmmmm.... probably not.  If everything had been spot on, I would have probably done 5 stars.   For the price, everything SHOULD have been spot on.  Oh yes.... guards for the splattering steak plates would have saved my blouse.
Have the New York!
Great happy hour! Delicious bacon blue cheeseburger and shrimp! Friendly staff! Nice cozy place. Business casual. We are definitely looking forward to going back!
Amazing food and wonderful waiter service! They were very attentive and recommended the best desert ever!!!

Good stake if you like your stake sitting in a butter boat. I agree, no ambiance,  poor wait staff. We were offered two other people's to go containers even before our waiter took our order. Then they tried to deliver the wrong food to us. …
The only destination for birthdays and anniversaries. Relaxing and stylish decor, impeccable yet personable service, and delectable food. It doesn't get better than Ruth Chris.
Great Steaks
Great food!
Great service and fresh ingredients cooked to perfection.  Highly recommended.

Wonderful salmon and overall experience. My dates steak was a little overdone on the outside compared to the rest of the people on our table and I would have liked a little more attention of the wait staff feeling glasses and bringing needed items but you can't complain about the great food overall.
One of the best steaks in the Treasure Valley.
Always a classy experience.  Best steaks you'll ever have.  Great place for a special occasion.

Best place to eat in Boise. I know, I know, it's a chain, but I'd rather eat here than tons of other places in Boise. Fantastic service and their steaks are perfection. We've been to a number of other steak places in Boise and they are not even close to Ruth's Chris.
We dine here several times a year and the experience was stellar, the food is incredible, and the service was great.   I wouldn't change a thing.
The calamary was rug brie baked potato too greasy
Great service and even better food!
First Class Restaurant with higher prices. Food couldn't be better!
Very upscale. 5 star customer service. Couldn't have gone better
Loved this place!
You have to try their carmalized bannana dessert !!  I have never had anything like it,  it is amazing !
Thank you for a wonderful birthday and our 49&43 years anniversary celebration. As always the food was delicious and our waiter was great.
Great food and wonderful serving staff. . Can not get this type of atmosphere anywhere else in Boise!
